meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indistinct.
meanings.sent1: The indistinctnesses of the painting made it hard to recognize the subject.
meanings.sent2: The photographer struggled to capture the beauty of the landscape due to the indistinctnesses in the image.
meanings.sent3: The indistinctnesses of the map led the hikers to take a wrong turn and end up in a different town.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of that day were shrouded in indistinctnesses, like trying to recall a dream upon waking.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctnesses of the ghostly figure in the fog created an eerie and mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Lack of clarity or sharpness in perception or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The indistinctnesses in his speech made it difficult for others to understand his message.
meanings.sent2: The indistinctnesses of the instructions caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: The indistinctnesses of the joke left everyone scratching their heads, unsure if it was funny or not.
meanings.sent4: The indistinctnesses in her thoughts clouded her decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctnesses in the witness's testimony raised doubts about the accuracy of the account.
